meanings.definition: A monetary unit equal to one hundredth of a basic monetary unit in several countries, including Tanzania and Latvia.
meanings.sent1: In Tanzania, you can buy a sweet for just one santimu.
meanings.sent2: I found a few santimu in my pocket while doing laundry.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant saved up a whole santimu to buy a shiny rock.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as rare as a santimu in the sand.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the santimu dropping echoed in the empty room.

meanings.definition: A coin worth one hundredth of a basic monetary unit in several countries, including Tanzania and Latvia.
meanings.sent1: My collection of coins includes a rare santimu from Latvia.
meanings.sent2: The street performer juggled santimu with ease.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stole a shiny santimu and buried it in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter rang like a handful of falling santimu.
meanings.sent5: The old well was filled with wishes in the form of santimu.
